description:
Coffee shops couldn't get more hipster than this.... it's a shipping container that has been repurposed into a coffee shop.

It's right in the middle of Patricia's Green so it serves as a great meeting spot to convene with friends, pick up some coffee, chill at the outdoor lot or, go about your merry way.

Coffee here is actually superb. They nail the drip coffee and the flavor profiles of their coffee beans is accurate (at least for me). Every cup of coffee I've had from here was brewed perfectly, no need for sugar or milk. 

It's pretty damn good coffee so I'll happily pay the $$ for it.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Havent been here in a year or so after a very rude encounter with an owner, decided to put it in the past and give them another go.  

This place has gone downhill. Unfriendly staff, the most watered down iced coffee I've ever had and priced accordingly (4.50?)

Other locations seem to be OK, but this spot, what a disappointment.
author: Scott R.

description:
Very poor customer service. Downright rude. I come here everyday because coffee is great. Too bad they can't be nice to their customers. 

They lost 1000 dollars in yearly business
author: Taher S.

description: Reminded me of a pop up coffee shop. Trendy, but mediocre coffee. Ordered a soy latte, which had a very light flavor and drowned down by the amount of soy milk. Staff was not approachable and did not seem too pleased while working there. Pricey, but did appreciate the design of the coffee sleeve. If you really need a caffeine boost, give another shop a try.
author: Ronald M.

description: One is my favorite places to get espresso on the planet. Every time I've stopped by this location, the baristas have the espresso dialed in perfectly and pull every shot with care and attention to detail. Kudos for taking the time and effort to ensure each shot tastes excellent.
author: Steve S.

description:
Roasted: cute little coffee shop. Tiny space with no indoor seating but some outdoor seating. Team was friendly but not overly engaging. Latte was good - milk quality was great (they use Clover!) and espresso was tasty however slightly too light of a roast for my liking. 

Unroasted: tiny shop in a cute location.  Plenty of outdoor seating to view the abundance of dog walkers.   Staff was okay, my latte was good.   If you like city outdoor coffee give it a shot.  No sugar added
author: Roasted Unroasted C.

description: Ice Latte is the best, must try! Really rich flavor and barista all maintain stable good quality.
author: Fay H.

description: Ritual in Hayes Valley is the perfect little coffee shop. Great espresso drinks and a wonderful staff that feels like family. I can't recommend this place enough!
author: Micah B.

description:
Good coffee 

Great quick creamy delicious macchiato - 

This is like a great handout spot too at the center of SF
author: Victor D.

description:
Located in a hipster shopping container.  Next to other shipping containers that serve speciality food/drinks.

They have a pretty simple menu.  Friendly customer service.

Chai Tea Latte:  Simple, not too sweet, good.
author: Saleen D.

description:
I love Ritual Coffee, its strong, delicious and keeps me awake. It totally does the trick. What first caught my eyes about this coffee was the logo of the brand. I thought it was pretty cool, reminded me of russian hammer and sickle which is very soviet. 

I come here sometimes, to this specific location. I always hit this spot up when i am in Hayes Valley for something. Its a fun, cute spot with great outdoor options. Very fast paste and lines are not too long. I have been to other locations where lines were insane, or maybe i just got lucky here. Either way... the coffee is worth to wait for!

Ritual Coffee Roasters also offer great pastries providing vegan options, which is super neat.
author: Galya T.

description: This is my favorite coffee spot in Hayes Valley. Right in the heart of Patricia's Green - super convenient and cute location. The customer service is fantastic and the coffee is delicious! Even for a simple cold brew gal, I'm super satisfied. Highly suggest making a pit stop here!
author: Sahar N.

description:
I came here two weeks ago on a weekend getaway, My friend highly recommend this coffee place and it was just across the street to a dog park and is next to the swell ice cream shop. 
Ritual's  latte is really good and baristas were cool and nice. 
The little place is cute and they have a little corner for donations to Sonoma Valley and Napa Valley. That weekend is the first weekend after the wildfire, I felt warmed by this little kindness.
"It is almost Halloween!" when I saw  dog bones and mini halloween pumpkin flags. 
They also offer tiny dog-bone shaped biscuits for puppy. and dog lovers? ( Me grabbed one...)
author: Donna B.

description: I'm not much of a coffee drinker but my friend said that he's been meaning to try this place. It's right by the quad area in a pop up shop. There's a small bench inside with lots of outdoor seating around the area. It's small and very busy. I got the Peru one and it was really strong. I mixed some milk/cream and brown sugar and it was good.
author: Lana W.

description:
I love this coffee place so much! I go there every time when im in town, the venue is soooo cool, people who work there are extremely helpful and nice. 
I will go there very morning if I live in that area. :)
author: Ao L.

description: The venue is really cool but the people who work here aren't super knowledgeable and have a pretty difficult time realizing they have a job due to paying customers who like coming here to get their enjoyment of coffee.  I liked the coffee very much, unfortunately service here left me with a bitter taste.
author: Zubair K.

description: Coffee Gem in SF. Ordered cafe latte. Good and strong. Sweet Nutty aroma. The coffee shop is very cozy. Friendly staff. Area around also very nice especially on a sunny day which you can sit outside to enjoy the area. Very chillaxing.
author: Katie M.

description:
I asked for coffee with whole cream. They don't have whole cream. I asked for artificial sweetener. They don't have artificial sweetener. I asked for a stir stick. They don't have stir sticks. All this would have been forgivable if the coffee was good. It was not. It was watery. 

The really sad thing is that the quality of the coffee was good: the beans were tasty and the roast was just right. It was just brewed with too much water. It didn't have to make me sad, but it did. Alas.
author: Maura S.

description: Great coffee - this is the place. However, if you want some top not h customer service, this cute shop is not the place to get it. In all sense, I would come if I was walking around in a hurry and only getting a Joe to-go.
author: kate w.

description: If a customer orders a cold brew but you run out of the batch, then you should let the customer know instead of giving the customer an iced filtered coffee without mention. If a customer confronts you, you should apologize instead of acting like a jerk and say that "they're the same thing." Let's be honest, if you know specialty coffee, the two are not the same. Not to mention, the two are different prices. Ritual, you lost a long time customer and supporter of your business today. If you don't train your baristas on customer service and proper ethics, you will not be in business for a long time.
author: Catherine M.

description:
- Great Capps.
- Street parking where you pay, unless you go on Guerrero or a side street. Not easy to find parking there. Paid parking is easy.
- Pastries are bars. No croissants
- No Wifi but has xfinity.
author: Vinay K.

description: On a long weekend trip to SF we had a list of 5 coffee roasters to try, including Ritual. We were disappointed to arrive here and see coffee only served in paper cups, but the disappointment quickly dissipated when I took a drink of my Burundi Gaharo Hill pour over coffee. This coffee was not just superior to any other coffee we tried in SF, but one of the best coffees I've ever had. I can not recommend this roaster enough, or this very fun, outdoor location.
author: Ricky P.

description: TERRRRRRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! We walked in at 6:59- doors wide open... the guy looks at us, says we're closed these are the last customers!!! No smile, unbelievably rude. Love ritual, this was shocking! Very disappointed in the lack of customer service!
author: elana w.

description:
Came in here on august literally 2 minutes before they opened and wanted to wash my hands before I bought a snack and a coffee when the white, brunette, rude hipster millennial who kind of had this awful Daria style of haircut told me WERE NOT OPEN and she pointed back outside LOL. 

I laughed in her face, looked at my watch and asked if she was serious. Like a child she said, "WERE NOT OOOPPEEEN YEEEEEEEET." I kid you not, she scowled, kind of stomped and pointed back outside. 

I asked if they had a restroom I could wash my hands before I ordered and she said "nothing for customers."

I laughed again and went to blue bottle coffee instead, I live closer to blue bottle anyway so it's a win. I no go to blue bottle for my coffee instead. F%#$ this place.
author: Gerald H.

description: Stopped by on a Saturday with a friend when we were exploring Hayes Valley for a quick pick me up. This Ritual coffee is in a prime location in Hayes valley, but has a weird layout. They have 1 door for ordering and 1 door for exiting, but we didn't see the signage for the doors. The barista saw us walk in and look around and told us that we couldn't use that door and to walk out and through the other if we wanted to order, which would have been more than fine as we made a mistake if it wasn't for the rude tone they used when they told us. The barista was not very friendly when she took our order either. I ordered a cold brew, which was $5 and disgusting. Overall, not a great experience because service was bad, coffee was bad, and overall vibe was bad. Will be going to blue bottle down the street next time!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Latte of the day! Taste really good, but it's too small, not enough for me!
And there is also no seats and very hard to find parking!

#latte #latteart #lattefortheday #ritualcoffee #ritual #c41250n #c41250nphotography #penf #olympus
author: Carson L.

description: One of the coolest coffee places in town. Very friendly group of people. You have a lot of out door seating options and you have a lot of great coffee options. By far my favorite. It's also always surrounded by adorable dogs, which doesn't hurt
author: Kyle V.

description: Im devoted to their cappucinos (now $4.25), and I feel like Im here every other day. Great flavor, a bit strong, light bitter but the milk cuts that nicely, and an awesome start to my morning. I wish theyd mentioned the stamp cards sooner!!!!! I woulda collected so many free drinks lol. Baristas remember your name, smile, ask how you doing?. They put good energy into their work, none of the jaded barista tudes you find elsewhere.
author: Thomas L.

description:
I'm honestly not terribly picky with my coffee--as long as the espresso is strong and the milk isn't burnt, I'm happy. The latte here did not disappoint, and while it was a bit costly after subbing in almond milk, it's SF. I'm used to it.
I've just stuck with the latte here, but they seem to have a pretty big selection of coffees to get as a pour-over, and a decent tea selection as well. Maybe next time.
The location is really cool; it's in a shipping container of sorts, and right in the super fun part of Hayes Valley. 
Everyone here is incredibly friendly and upbeat, and coming here early on a Saturday morning was pretty fun. Grab your coffee, go sit in the park outside, and get showered with the love of all the dogs being walked.
author: Gautam G.

description: Love coffee so let's taste Ritual's. Cappuccino was excellent but not very hot. House hot coffee was light and flavorful.
author: L D.

description: Good and clean space, generous cup of coffee.  The negative is no Wifi.
author: Siv L.

description:
I come here almost every morning, because I love the coffee- but also because the people that work here are so delightful.

I can count on Ritual to be open from 7AM-7PM every day. I used to go to Blue Bottle on Linden St. but when they were closed January 1st and I needed a good latte, I found Ritual. I've been going ever since. I also really like their selection of pastries, they often run out by the end of the day so its best to go early if you're counting on a snack.

Since I've gotten to know most of the staff, their pleasant demeanor has overwhelmed me. I feel comfortable asking them lots of questions, especially about product and feel good about taking recommendations from them as well.

Mandy recently reccomended I try a Mocha, a coffee I have never tried before and honestly I was surprised! Where has mocha been all my life?!! :)

Kingsley (sp?) made me a slow drip coffee that changed my life. I never knew coffee could be so complex!

I could go on and on about the staff, (particularly the swan latte art I received the other day!) but I will stop gushing as to not be obnoxious. 

I really appreciate Ritual coffee existing so close to me in Hayes Valley. They make the parklet area so pleasant, what with the seating they provide and the community they help thrive. I am happy to have a home base coffee place! Thank you, Ritual! Keep doing what you're doing!
author: Katie-Ross W.

description: These people are great. I love coming here for the really great coffee as well as the people that serve it. I usually try to go every Saturday to grab a cup before I do my shopping and they're get it started for me right away. Whenever there are a lot of people, they always apologize for a little bit of a wait but it's always worth it.
author: Eileen K.

description: I'm usually not a huge fan of coffee but this was was very high quality and warmed us up (it was a bit chilly in July) . Workers kind of dry but good place to try if your into coffee.
author: Helen M.

description: I love this little shop in the center of Hayes Valley.  Perfect espresso to grab and sit in the park and enjoy the day. Decent prices and friendly service.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
This permanent popup location (is there such a thing as permanent popup?) is in the middle of the Proxy business/lifestyle area. Out in the open and easily accessible, a great place to stop and get a pick me up if you're shopping in the Hayes Valley area or if you just want to sip your coffee and eat your Miette, Chantal Guillon, or La Boulange de Hayes pastries while sitting and relaxing at the mini-urban park right next to it.  

The baristas were friendly and efficient with the usual quality you can expect with Ritual. I ordered a single origin cappuccino from Nicaragua and it was awesome.
author: Howie C.

description: Their mocha warms my belly. I drink it every morning. Treat yourself to a nice ritual coffee. Their milk is warm, their chocolate bitter, and their foam is bubbly.
author: Joshua S.

description: I love their coffee but this time I tried the oolong tea. It was great. Espresso coffee was so tasty and strong. Just the way I like it. Fast service and very friendly. It's great place to grab and go wonder the fun neighborhood.
author: Akiko I.

description:
I was in the mood for a good cappuccino...last time I asked for one, I was served a lukewarm version of a latte with a pretty design on top. 
So this time, I thought I would be more specific and described how I'd like my cappuccino to be made. The barista tells me "that's not our standard" to which I replied "I'm your customer, and I would very much appreciate if you could make it the way I'm asking you to make it".
She remain "pleasant" and served me another lukewarm latte.
author: Anne Parker J.

description: The service and level of efficiency is quite possibly the worst i've seen at a cafe in the city. The employees could use training in both customer service and barista code of conduct.
author: Nic ..

description:
Great boutique-y coffee place to try on a weekend and enjoy the park/plaza and seating in the vicinity. Surprisingly, there was not a long line at 2pm on a Sunday, and despite only having a few drip machines, they processed orders quickly while making conversation and complimenting my friend's attire.  

Mocha 4.5/5: This was by far one of the best mochas I've had recently.  I've become used to finding a thick glob of half melted chocolate residing at the bottom in a swampy goopy mess.  This was not the case with Ritual's mocha which stayed a perfect consistency and light frothy milky smoothness even though sipped it slowly until it cooled down to room temperature. I liked that this mocha was not overly sweet, and I did not have to ask to have the sweetness lessened.  

Americano 4/5: This was a decent chilled drink, but like all iced coffees in my experience, tasted a bit watered down.  This may just be a personal preference, but in general, I find that iced coffees without a lot of cream or sweetener are just very plain and the brew is not strong enough to bring out a good flavor in the drink amongst the ice.  I do have  a tendency to drink slowly, so this probably exacerbates the wateriness.

Maybe I'm used to high priced coffee in SF nowadays, but the price of their drinks was exactly what I expected for Hayes.  In addition, it's nice that they advertise their fair trade environmentally friendly processes, doing their due diligence in being San Franciscan.  The day I was there, it was overcast and too cold for Smitten ice cream, but still acceptable weather to be hanging out outdoors by the food truck and park in the area.  

Would I come back? Sure, when I'm in the neighborhood.  Ritual is a great place to go for coffee after a weekend brunch or lunch when you want to socialize, but don't really have any plans in mind; I wouldn't necessarily make the trek here just for coffee though.
author: Kathy T.

description: Loved the coffee. It's too small to be called a "shop" as there is really no indoor seating and on this rainy day, that mattered. It has more of a pop-up feel. I thought the coffee was really tasty and well-made. The service was friendly although the barista made quite a show of the fact that she didn't really want to be there. But the cashier was great and the barista did make a great cappuccino. You get the full HV experience: A guy in a Tesla in the handicapped parking space parked there with his flashers on while he jogs in wearing a full color-coordinated Under Armour ensemble. Many North Face jackets and purebred dogs and everyone heads down on their phones unless they're taking pictures of the dogs for Instagram. But if you want some cliche with your latte, this is the spot.
author: Brian B.

description:
Once again another great experience! Their service is efficient and most importantly their coffee is on point. They automatically start the drip process as soon as you make the order. 

I ordered their Ethiopian roast plain black which had notes of lavender and a fruit base. The taste was light and the finish was pretty sour but still had it's dark roast taste.

Their mocha was made with this chocolate brand which tasted good but very milky. It was probably a milk chocolate of some type or a low percentage dark chocolate. Normally I like my mochas strong and bold tasting but this tasted good! 

This spot is always a nice go-to whenever time is spent in Hayes!
author: Allister D.

description:
I tried their $4 WolfMother special which is a drink served in a small whiskey glass that must be consumed there. 

It comes with a cool shaped ice cube and is creamy and sweet (not too sweet where the sweetness overpowers the bitter flavors of the coffee). The drink is made with juniper berries so it has a nice berry sweetness to it that is subtle but definitely distinct. 

I love that this location is in a crate container among other crate container shops (juice shop, Smitten ice cream) and there are outdoor chairs for you to enjoy your coffee. It's also next to a park so you can dog watch while you sip on your coffee. They also serve moon pies & pastries & you can buy cool souvenirs like cups and patches. 

I also love the name of this coffee spot. Rituals is a perfectly fitting name for the solemn rite that is coffee/caffeine addiction. They have tea options here too that I have yet to try.
author: Brenda L.

description: Great coffee. Even the brewed ahead coffee is fantastic. Should remember to get an at before going home.
author: Brian B.

description: I liked the storage container used as a store front, but didn't care for the actual coffee- the Wild Pony was overpowered by the lemon rind, but the Dark Horse espresso was just okay. The provided dining area seemed to have only chairs and no tables available, which I found odd. Service was pretentious and a little disengaged. I'd try one of their regular brews if in the area again, but the specials are a little too out there for me.
author: Stefany V.

description: Very cool little coffee booth right near the heart of Hayes Valley. Coffee was of course delicious. Service was impeccable. Best of all, I spied a new Baratza grinder that I'd never heard of before, the successor to the one I use at home--very exciting to know that it had been upgraded. I guess it was lucky for me that at that hour on a Sunday morning, Ritual was the only coffee joint open within blocks. Thanks, guys!
author: Mr J.

description:
This is without question the most disappointing coffee I've had in San Francisco. Without any shadow of a doubt. 

Ritual was recommended to me by a friend who also suggested I check out Four Barrel and Sight Glass. Both were excellent. Following a lead from when I ordered at Four Barrel, I asked for a quad shot latte and received a regular one (it was weak and also lacked crema). My partner asked for a soy latte, as he is lactose intolerant, and was served a coffee with dairy milk. 

Next time I'll take the recommendation given by one of my friends and go to the juice bar next door, which is also meant to be great. 

Agree with other reviewers that parking is a nightmare, but that didn't stop one thoughtless customer double-parking his BMW on the tactile strips at the crossing for vision impaired people to go in and order coffee.
author: Mathew K.

description:
Ritual is the BEEZ NEES. 

I know everyone is in love with Blue Bottle and/or Philz, but this place makes the most fantastic coffee I've ever had in my life. I don't normally enjoy my coffee black but here it is always the perfect temperature, not bitter and has the most delicious velvety texture.

Warning: This is definitely a spot for coffee purists, no fancy fake sugars or surgary coffee drinks here. Hell, not even wifi! But if you want an amazing cup of joe...this place doesn't disappoint. 

I seriously give everyone I know gifts of Ritual coffee :) and they love it every time!
author: Jackie C.

description: Don't be fooled by the predictably slick yet forgettable design job - this is overpriced bad coffee served by the least friendly people on the peninsula. I've had better tasting ayahuasca than the acrid sludgy attempt at espresso that was served to me by a person recounting to everyone in earshot all the usually unmentionable parts of one's life. Also why is an espresso $3.50 here now? God help us all.
author: Nat U.

description:
Yes. This place rocks. Small outpost off Hayes street with an excellent selection of beans and a cool atmosphere. 

The mission location is great as well, but this place has a unique vibe and locale.
author: Shaun J.

description:
Can't go wrong with Ritual. I like that this is a pick-up-and-go kind of place situated in the middle of Hayes Valley. I always get the cold brew here. It's pretty consistent most of the time, but sometimes it can get a little too acidic for me. I've tried the mocha here and it's pretty good, but it's a heavier option for coffee. The mocha is really rich - that's the only word I can think of to describe it. 

There are a few seats around if you want to enjoy your coffee there, but it's really easier to just pick it up and walk around the nice area!
author: Steph V.

description:
Why yes, yes I do want to purchase a toasty beverage from a smiling face in a shipping container. Thanks, Ritual. 

While I don't see the Chicago burbs catching onto the shipping container trend I enjoyed in Hayes Valley, I can fully appreciate the quality of beverage created. My hot chocolate was none too sweet, smooth, and just delicious overall. Hubs enjoyed his basic cup o' joe and we were in and out of the line/park area/shipping container vicinity within a few minutes. It's not the cheapest of beverages, but since I like quirk, novelty, and local, Ritual definitely had me hooked.

If you're feeling snacky they do offer a small array of baked goods that looked pretty tasty as well.
author: Nicole W.

description:
This Ritual location is kind of random because it's more of a grab-n-go joint instead of an actual sit-down-and-enjoy-your-coffee place, although there is plenty of outdoor seating right next to the park. 

Tried their latte and their mocha; both very good. Their mocha isn't too sweet which I like, and both times the drinks haven't been either too strong or too weak but just right. A fun fact about Ritual while waiting in line: they specialize in light roasts in terms of their pour-over style coffee. If you're looking for a dark/medium roast.. they will probably suggest their latte or just a plain shot of espresso. Still have yet to try their pastries (they are below the counter; gotta look down while you're at the register!) Also, a huge fan of their latte art!
 
Prices are around 3.5-5 bucks for a cup of coffee depending on the size and type of drink you order. A little bit above average but worth trying if you haven't yet!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Coffee is good  but customer service is shit. Accidentally went to grab a coffee that was  the same order as mine and the guy was very abrasive about it! Even put his hand up like a stop sign. Aside from that, location is spot on
author: Faith S.

description:
Finding a solid, fresh cup of drip coffee in San Francisco has become a dime a dozen. Especially working right in the heart of SOMA and Hayes Valley, I have my choices of local hipster coffee joints and roasters within blocks of my building -- literally. 

Call me a Coffee Snob, but Yes I already expect my coffee to be at the bare minimum 
*Freshly grounded 
*Made 1 cup at a time
*Dead strong
*Almond milk substitute 
*Local -- Loves supporting my small SF 
startups! 
*Cute merchandise swag
*Artsy branded paper cups-- Yes, I judge
*Blah, blah, blah.. the list goes on 

So what makes a coffee shop or any restaurant in San Francisco's over saturated restaurant scene stand out is obviously the going to be the Ambience and Customer Service -- you know, they Feel Good vibe you get when you show up and leave with. 

Ritual has all the above. This coffee "cart" setup is perfect for the Hayes Valley niche -- simple, unpretentious, and cute as heck! It's decked out with Ritual merchandise -- all red everything baby! 

The baristas here take great care with each of their customers and every cup is made special. Prices are very reasonable if you're talking "hipster" coffee numbers -- $3-5 for pour over/ drip coffee depending on the blend you chose. 

Keep it up. The neighborhood loves you! #SF #LocalPride
author: Ellen W.

description: Very good espresso. Would have given them 5 stars if they had whipped cream for my mocha
author: Jeanne B.

description: Came here on Sunday and LOVED it.  The location is in a beautiful, central spot in Hayes Valley near an amazing park.  The service was stellar as the staff was vibrant and friendly.  If I lived nearby I would be here everyday.  Ordered the Angel Reserve pour over and was extremely impressed!  My gf ordered the mocha iced latte and was very pleased as well!  Until next time!  Thanks again
author: Drew M.

description:
I had heard pretty great things about Ritual before coming here, so, to be fair, my expectations were pretty high. 

Don't get me wrong, the coffee was great. But it didn't stand out among the other coffee I've had by much. I got a latte. They made a pretty design out of cream on the top of my drink, which I appreciated, but taste-wise it wasn't as ~life changing~ as I expected. I should note that my cashier was fairly friendly and willing to recommend drinks, with me being a first timer and all.

The interior was minimal and airy. It had very high ceilings which make the space feel huge. As for seating, there was a fair amount, but the place was super crowded so I ended up having to stand at the "bar" area. Although some may like that set up, after walking around in the rain all day, all I wanted was a place to sit.

Basically, I would recommend trying this place because 1) the coffee is totally fine and 2) it's another cafe you can put under your belt. But will I be returning? Probably not.
author: Lucy C.

description: Ritual has a creative and unique physical place, and is a cozy place to grab a small cup of coffee. I ordered the coldbrew and it had a pleasant flavor that was complimented well by the cream and simple syrup provided. The staff is friendly but not overly talkative, and the location is convenient for a spur of the moment drink.
author: Micah H.

description:
Come on a sunny day because that is when you can sip on some Ritual coffee and lounge on the seats that are provided right on the ground field!

Quite enjoyable with the surrounding that offers a laid back atmosphere.

The latte itself is smooth and not on the strong side.  I do suggest the coffee if you want a good kick!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
For those of us not smitten with Smitten, you need walk no further than the other side of the mobile kiosk in the otherwise vacant lot next to Patricia's Green. There you'll see that Ritual Coffee Roasters has popped up and taken full advantage of the lengthy vertical counter space to make artisan hand-brewed cups of coffee one at a time. It's a more relaxing set-up than Smitten because they scattered white patio furniture all around to make it feel like an outdoor lounge. On this particularly wintry afternoon, it felt more like a gulag prison yard, but the intent was spot-on.

They serve all the normal caffeine concoctions and four of their fair-trade blends described in detail on one clipboard sheet. I went for the most premium, the $5 cup of El Silencio from Colombia, which sounded like what I was looking for, a moment of solitude to sip my brew after a hearty burger at Chez Maman West. It was indeed "candy-like" as billed because it was infused with grape lollipops (no kidding), currants and vanilla. The sweet taste was subtle but nice. My heart still belongs to Philz for these kind of one-off coffees, but it's good to see an alternative to the line that forms just a few yards away down Linden Alley for Blue Bottle. Good stuff.

COFFEE - 4 stars...silky smooth, subtly sweet and hand-dripped for an eternity
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...I like the use of space around here, very communal yet private
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...nice enough
TOTAL - 4 stars...a perfect spot on a Saturday for lollygagging with your Kindle
author: Ed U.

description:
I stopped in here the other day on a walk across the city. The coffee was good (I just got the one that was made already, not a pourover). They were a little understaffed however, for a busy Sunday afternoon. I had to wait (though I was the only one in line) before anyone addressed me, and the baristas made no eye contact or attempt to engage. 

Extra pros: it is in such a cute location! Also, I got my coffee quickly, which was all I needed!
author: Kendall S.

description: More amazing coffee gracing the Hayes Valley area. Stopped by here on a lovely Saturday morning and was greeted with a long, but relatively fast-moving line. I went for a latte which was ordered and brewed pretty quickly which was great. Latte was delicious--definitely more on the milky side which is what I like. They've got a nice selection of different specialty coffees and teas as well.
author: Jasmine X.

description:
I'm sorry but I don't think this coffe is good. It's pretty watery.
And the espresso is also incredibly weak and small 
I got a double shot and it was like 3/4 of an inch 

Not to mention the staff on multiple occasions have been incredibly lack luster. 
I saw them throw away someone's latte after calling it out 3 times...the guy came in a minute later and they said sorry we were calling your name but...we could make you another one...but you'll have to wait til we make everyone else's orders first...

I was dumbfounded 

I had to stand outside to wait for mine because the vibes were so gross...not how I want to start my day!
author: Kyle J.

description:
Love this location. Double check, there may be something wrong with you if you don't enjoy the extreme charm of this spot. I do. Enough to write it a poem.

Kind, kind, she behind the counter. 
Grand Grand, Square-pay via wooden iPad stand.
Drip, drip, my heavenly Columbian cup of Los Gigantes.
Sip, sip, that life-giving deliciousness oh so hip. 
Chill, chill, the Hayes Valley vibe supreme.
Habitual, habitual, I wish I lived closer to this Ritual.
author: Ted R.

description:
Solid coffee, great location.

They have a nice selection of brews and cool latte art. Great service and staff. No complaints!
author: Leana L.

description: Hands-down, my favorite almond milk latte.. it's the machine or barista whipping the almond milk so creamy that is the major difference, even better than blue bottle down the alley -- YUM
author: Caroline L.

description:
I love how consistent my coffee drinks are here. I've never had anything but delicious coffee.

Everyone is so nice too! I was worried since it's so hip...that people would be mean but nope super friendly and knowledgeable about their roasts.

Also you can get reusable mason jars here and bring them back for a discount on your drink. They even sell koozies for your jars. Woohoo!
author: Sujin Y.

description:
Ritual brings it every time.  I find that the attachment to Smitten's ice cream stand makes for a convenient and affordable location for the cold mornings and nights when you want nothing more than a warm cup in your hand, keeping your body at a good temperature.

The coffee is smooth and delightfully full-bodied, without being overbearing or too acidic.  The foam is made perfectly every time for those latte-lovers who only dream of a milk mustache as they approach.   The staff was charming and funny as I took pictures and they made sure to pose for my shots.  

Now that Blue Bottle isn't the only option in Hayes Valley I might be indecisive on which to try out for the day.  Thanks Ritual, for making my coffee-decisions that much more difficult.
author: Kevin J.

description:
So maybe Ritual's logo design & colors conjure up images of Communist Party propaganda posters; that's no reason to shy away from their coffee (seriously, am I the only one slightly bothered by the star & sickle-esque symbol?!) This one-cup-at-a-time operation is run out of a shipping container near the park & shops in Hayes Valley, an unbeatable location. 

The line inched along, but the baristas acknowledged those of us holding up the rear, which went a long way in terms of customer satisfaction & probability of return visits.

My decaf iced mocha was delightfully chocolatey & rich, & had a velvety texture probably from the almond milk. Nice amount of bite without being bitter or overly acidic. Hella good would be an accurate description. 4.5 enthusiastic stars.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Pros:
- best coffee I've ever had
- "Los Gigantes" whole bean
- "El Angel" whole bean (maybe my favorite)
- iced latte was so smooth, rich, and flavorful
- one of the few coffees I can (and prefer to) drink black
- roasted in SF!
- perfect for home espresso machines
- coffee packages state when the bean was roasted to ensure freshness

Cons:
- why do you have to cost so much whyyyyyyyy (so worth it)
- baristas are a bit coffee snobby

Bottom line: Ritual is frequently rated as the best coffee in the Bay Area for a reason. I have yet to find a coffee that I like more than these and I love going to work in the morning because it means I can have Ritual when I get there. If you enjoy coffee, this is a must.
author: Jiann M.

description:
Great atmosphere, great coffee, and best of all great staff. Barista gave us sample drinks of the cold nitro brew. We decided against it and ordered what we initially wanted.  Everything was served with a smile from people who wanted to be there and enjoy their jobs. 

Checkout the outdoor seating designed like a boat!
author: Raul M.

description: Pretty delicious. I tired their Ethopia blend- iced. A little acidic for my taste but had great flavor. On the first sip, it tasted like berries almost, but it went away after the next few sips. This cup of coffee was made as a pour over. It didn't take very long but they apologized for the wait and gave us a coupon for one of them on the next visit. My friends and I were greeted by a really nice barista who was patient while we each picked our coffees (Sorry for being THAT customer!). I tried the costa rica and that was also great! It's a pretty bright coffee, probably would pair well with something citrusy. Overall, I definitely enjoyed the ritual coffee roasters! If I am back in SF I would most definitely come by again!
author: Tida C.

description:
Surprised at some of the mixed reviews here, as I've had much different experiences. I'd tasted Ritual before at a coffee tasting demonstration/seminar and found it an incredibly heavenly experience, and now that there's an outlet right near Blue Bottle in Hayes Valley, I've tried espressos at both kiosks, back-to-back, twice now.

I hate to say this to Blue Bottle - and I love you to pieces - but I'd give Ritual a slight edge... perhaps the best espresso I've had (yet). Seriously rich, bold, and full of hints of different flavors. A real mouth-watering, soul-satisfying trip. Truly a cup to savor slowly. When I'm in Hayes Valley, I would absolutely do Blue Bottle and Ritual back-to-back again.

You folks who live there are d**n lucky and d**n spoiled! ;)
author: Vincent L.

description:
After brunch at Chez Maman catching up with a friend we felt a cup of coffee was in order. We almost resorted to Blue Bottle when I remembered there is a Ritual stand in the area. 

I'm used to the Mission location and I've  never been disappointed with their rich, dark and full bodied coffee. The coffee at this location, in a shipping crate no less was no different. What's not to like?
author: Esther A.

description:
Yes! Just all kinds of yes. 

High & above your average coffee drink. Friendly and nice service and baristas. Cute little open air space. Lovely heart decorated latte designs (see photo). Price is that of boutique coffee house because it's exactly that. Highly recommend this spot!

Why not 5 stars then? Because, to be perfectly honest, not quite as good as Blue Bottle...ouch but truth. Go try it yourself :)
author: Brian K.

description:
Absolutely excellent coffee. Cold brew, pour over, and the standards.  I'm particularly picky about mochas - they're usually too sweet, cheap chocolate or not well blended.  This is top 5 in the city, easily.
Small selection of artisan baked goods (more than one bakery represented, which, for some reason, I think is cool).
Only thing is that it borders on pretentious (or maybe just not my personal aesthetic).
Also, $5 for a mocha - unfortunately getting to be normal price.
author: Rachel M.

description: Ritual Coffee Roasters is quite the experience! The place is clean and aesthetically pleasing. I always order my coffee black, so I get the cute little wooden tray with cups to pour my own coffee. There is also plenty of places to sit around and enjoy your beverage. Minus one star because the service does not stand out as amazing, which is important to me when I get my coffee. I understand that the baristas are always busy, but there is not always a welcoming vibe when I come here. I guess it's just all about the coffee!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
So painfully hip. 

Allow me to list the reasons why 
1. It's in Hayes Valley 
2. It's in a bunker 
3. It's Ritual 
4. Their coffee is hand picked by virgin monks in the jungles wearing vegan eco friendly garments. 

I'm totes kidding about #4. 

They accept payment via cash or square. Some people complain about price but if you do, then you should probably just go to Starbucks and drink your diabetes in a cup.

 
carefully crafted coffees. 

BUT HEY. You! Hipster girl who also ordered a siberia AFTER my friend and I. How dare you take one of the Siberias when two was placed on the counter. That was totes obvy OURS so we had to keep waiting for another *evil sideeye* 

Painfully hip hipsters everywhere. Beware.
author: Susy C.

description: Excellent creamy espresso! I had the sweet tooth and my husband had the seasonal espresso. His had more citrus to it but mine was smooth and sweet. Made perfectly. One of my favorites, ever!
author: Katie D.

description:
This little outdoor coffee shop is great. The coffees and teas are made in front of you, in the heart of the gorgeous Hayes Valley. The staff is super smiley and helpful.
I've had their carrot tea (original!) and iced tea, both very affordable (around 3$) and good.
My husband loves their coffee and says it's the best he's ever had!
I love the little seating area in front of the shop, perfect to enjoy the sun rays while enjoying on your drink!
author: Leslie S.

description: okay, confession...serious coffee snob here.  over the years been lucky enough to find a handful of places that qualify as religious coffee experiences.  today added this place to the list...the pour over was perfect from the beans, to the roasting, the grind, water and careful execution.  the clouds parted....hallelujah!
author: Bob H.

description:
Finally, I don't have to hit the Mission to get my hands on a beautiful cup of Ritual's caffeinated gold! 

This three year pop up community in Hayes Valley sure is nifty.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
This is my favorite coffee in the city!! It's right around the corner from where I work, which makes it even better. I always get a cappuccino and it's so tasty and satisfying. Reminds of the great coffee my home country had, which is a comforting extra perk. I find many coffees is this city to be acidic and hard to digest and this coffee is smooth and has more of a mocha balance for me. I love it!
It also helps that the baristas here are nice and friendly.
author: Schisandra S.

description:
Sitting back to back with Smitten Ice Cream in Hayes Valley... in a cut open bunker/shipping container sits this hipsterificly awesome coffee joint... Ritual Coffee Roasters!

It's been a little while since I've had their coffee and I've even gone to bring their beans home, but it wasn't until recently that I got to pop in for an iced latte that I fell in love with Ritual again. I don't know if the atmosphere and the San Francisco sun during sundown along with the light breeze had anything to do with influencing me to rank the coffee the way I do, but this is perfection. Absolute perfection. 

Hats off to the barista that hooked me up with the perfect balance of espresso and ice cold whole milk. You sir, have made my motherf!@#$'n day. 

WORD OF ADVICE: Parking sucks. That is all.
author: Mike D.

description:
(See pics) Review #1313. I always love Ritual, especially when they used to do Clover, but that was some sad history.

They make an excellent cup here, in the bright happy warm sun, a wonderful pick-me-up and slow-me-down all at the same time. And yeah, with the outdoors love. Yes, BB is only a block away, but on a weekend afternoon where you do not need the hard kick to focus but still want something lightly roasted (relaxing but strong), here comes the Ritual drink.

They do have some pastries if you want something to nibble with.

Grab a cup of cap and sit either in their area or at the "park" area.
author: T L.

description:
Wow... I did not realize Ritual had a spot in Hayes Valley... AWESOME!

A small counter in the heart of the bustling Hayes Valley, surrounded by a plethora of hipster boutiques and restaurants, in the middle of Patricia's Green park. Perfect for resting after a busy day in the city or after exploring the numerous shops close by! Always a treat checking out their seasonal espresso's, and this most recent winter seasonal was delightful and tasty.

As one of my favorite roasters in the bay, I'm glad to have another beacon to pitstop along my journeys to recaffeinate!
author: Kevin J.

description:
Man their drip coffee was good.  I like coffee on the milder side and had their Ecuador beans.  Very good.  

Grabbed the coffee and hung out in the park.  Fun little corner.
author: Rob W.

description:
One of the sacred coffee places in SF, this place resides in a shipping container right on Octavia next to the little park area. There's no way you would miss its logo which resembles a certain political party's symbol.

It's nice to be next to a couple parks (and the super cool Aether store), so you could sip coffee while hanging out in the sun, if the weather permits. Smitten is right next door so you can make your own affogato right there.

That said, the coffee is pretty good. They do simple, down-to-earth drips and espressos. I still like Blue Bottle's roasts more, but this is definitely pretty close.
author: Alice C.

description:
This Ritual Coffee Roasters pop-up-esque  location is great.  I love coffee and I love being outdoors on a sunny day.  A weekend ago, I met a friend of mine there.  We come from very different cultures, he is Native American and is now parapalegic because of a construction accident.  
He has lived many lives and as I talk with him, I'm thankful to learn from his experience.  We are from different generations and even though, I am a brat sometimes, I do appreciate his advice, even if I don't follow it.

Some commonalities that we share:  OUR LOVE OF COFFEE.

He ordered the Guatemalan drip and I the Ethiopian.  Yet, we both had a wonderful day in the sun listening to a band and looking at the burning man art installation at the park on Octavia...groovy.  Also my fave:  the MOCHA.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Loved my latte! Probably one of the best I've ever had. 

Service was eh...I've definitely had better baristas. 

I bought a bag of their beans 12 oz for $17...definitely more than I pay for my local roaster, but they surely are delicious beans. I saw bags for $21 for 12 oz and I was thinking "seriously?". I'm used to buying freshly roasted beans, but that seems pretty damn ridiculous. 

I'd definitely visit again, I just wish the beans were a little more affordable.
author: Kelli H.

description: Excellent coffee!! Will travel extra distance for another cappuccino!! Highly recommended!! So good!!
author: Ji J.

description:
I have been ruined by Ritual. By that, I mean I'm literally grossed out by any other coffee now. That pour-over oily bitterness gets me every time, with both their hot and iced drinks. Definitely a haven for those of us who drink our coffee black (if you like sweet, frilly drinks, you're probably better off elsewhere)

The staff is great. Not the snobby hipster coffee spot at all, like Four Blue Barrel Bottle places nearby. I work in the neighborhood and walk over here 3-4 times a week. I even converted my salon coworkers to Ritual

But the Los Gigantes, yall have to bring that back. I almost took down a star for it ;)
author: Brittany B.

description:
Had come here for Smitten, but was stoked to find Ritual behind it. Coffee + ice cream, can't go wrong. Made affogato in mah mouf.. kinda. Big big fan of their cappuccinos and their not-too-sweet mochas. And if you want, walk down the alleyway, get something at Blue Bottle, and have yourself a little coffee tasting.

Takes credit. Cute shipping container, I'm a sucker for this type of thang.
author: Vivian H.

description: Love this location of Ritual!! Hayes Valley is one of my favorite neighborhoods in San Francisco. I love spending time relaxing in the park and sipping on an americano from Ritual. The coffee is one of my favorites in the city and they have always have delicious baked goods (vegan options included)! When I was here a few days ago I asked the employee working what her favorite blends are because I just bought a knew coffee maker. She was very nice and described the differences in each type of coffee. It was very helpful and I appreciate her recommendations!
author: Rachel S.

description: I've been to this particular Ritual Coffee location a few times, but never any other spots. I love this area in Hayes Valley and I love this location. It's in the middle where all the little restaurants and shops are at, where people walk past with their dogs, and where people are just simply relaxing and enjoying the day. The coffee itself is delicious and service is quick. While I love my Starbucks and Philz Coffee, there's always a wait, but I've never had a long wait here ever! The great coffee, awesome location and superb service make this such an ideal spot to just hang out during the day or to take a break from work. Plus, Smitten Ice Cream is right next door! Coffee and ice cream break, anyone?? Will be back!
author: Becky C.

description:
One of the few Buster friendly places in HV. They have fantastic coffee here and complimentary mini milk bones for your doggy. The coffee is hand brewed and they have some unusual flavor combinations. The Costa Rica is my current fav. 

Order coffee here, walk your poochy around the park, and come back and grab your coffee!
author: Laura F.

description:
Amazing baristas. Amazing cappuccinos (seriously). Amazing location.

It doesn't hurt that the sweet smells from Smitten drift over to Ritual's kiosk, either.
author: Gabriela K.

description: My favorite cup of coffee while I was in SF. Pour-over was awesome. Come here and hang out too, one of the coolest blocks in the cities. I wasn't planing on chilling out while I was there but the vibe was too cool not to. At a place as hipster as this, you run the risk of indifferent service. Not here! Baristas were awesome and helpful.
author: Craig R.

description: Friendly staff, attention to detail. Had a cappuccino with soy. A bit pricey for what it is, but still a great cup of espresso. Open door seating on a sunny Friday definitely a great experience.
author: Teresa J.

description: Great cup of cappuccino constructed by nice baristas. Nice scene, pleasant area to hang out.  If it were a coffee shop instead of a coffee stand, it would be 5 stars.
author: Joel S.

description:
Was it because of the coffee I got?  I wasn't really impressed...

I totally agree with Jason B.  Their story and their ritual of coffee making is much more impressive than their end product.  I love that they fully support their coffee producers - they buy their coffee beans direct , so there's no middleman.  During my quest to find all the best coffee spots in San Francisco, I've learned that coffee making is truly an art form.  Every action is done with reason.  Unfortunately, I'm not really sure what's going on here....  

I don't remember the name of my coffee, but I remember it was from Brazil.  It was coffee with a fruity hint... maybe I'm just not sophisticated enough to appreciate this, but it just tasted a bit strange to me.  Since it was my first time here, I asked the barista for her opinion.  Apparently, this coffee is one of their best-sellers.  

I won't totally write this place off yet.  With so many awesome reviews, I must be missing something.  I'll be back again, but next time, I'll stick to the old-fashion traditional coffee.  

OTHER STUFF:

- Parking is a pain... good luck
- It's not an actual coffee shop.  It looks like a bungalow of some sort that opens up?  Interesting concept.
- I kind of dig the little seating area.  It's very low maintenance - just a bunch of little chairs and abstract tables on a gravel surface
author: Cecilia S.

description:
You know those "basic training" monkey bars across from Ritual Coffee? Well, I decided to take a shot at proving my strength, jumped up for the bars, and promptly smashed by bloody shin into the steel frame hinge. I collapsed from the shock and pain, pulling my hand from the injury to see the skin imprinted and purple. I needed some ice, and fast!

Ritual Coffee came to the rescue, even bagging the ice for me and tying it off with a bow. Thanks to their compassion, I was able to sit curbside with the compress to my leg, and enjoy a deliciously crafted latte. Smooth espresso and densely foamed milk plus the cold pressure brought me back to life, and I was up and running through the grass field in a jiffy. 

My boyfriend said that as he was waiting in line for the ice, the woman in front of him leveled a complaint at the barista. Customer: "I ordered a soy latte." Barista 1: "That is a soy latte" Barista 2: "Dang girl! That's a soy latte?! You are getting good!" That's right folks, she steamed the milk so perfectly that the customer could not believe it was soy. Bravo Ritual Coffee, bravo.
author: Mars W.

description: Super nice guy giving quality advice on tea choice in cute cut-out shipping container storefront in hip Hayes Valley. The carrot tea was a perfect after dinner note. Can't wait to come back for coffee!
author: N C.

description:
I really like their little unassuming stand in Hayes. It adds a lot to the local flavor while serving great coffee, what's there not to like? Keep in mind its a kiosk that serves Third Wave coffee if you're into that.

Some people will ask if you prefer Blue Bottle or Ritual since they are literally down the alley from each other but who cares? Both are great & depending on your desire for a larger coffee selection, Ritual would probably be the way to go. The Blue Bottle kiosk is a bit more for drinks since its not their usual full blown coffee store.
author: Steven C.

description:
Ritual Coffee offers really strong coffee with mild acidic qualities. Just the way I like it!

I liked that they offer several varieties of drip coffees to choose from. I can see myself coming back to try other flavors when I am in the area.

Overall Thoughts

Coffee, Coffee, Coffee!!!! =)
author: Eddie W.

description:
Our afternoon trip into ritual was just about perfect. There was a short line, which gave us adequate time to check out the menu. My group of 4 ordered one macchiato, a cappuccino, and 2 drip coffees. I opted for the 75 cent increase for the more premium espresso in my cappuccino- which proved worth it, because it was sublime. So sweet and decadent it required no additional sweetener. The milk was rich and frothy and I loved the delicate foam art on top. 

We loved the method they use to brew coffee. My husband and our pal stood and watched their coffee being brewed with amazement. The coffee was smooth, full bodied, and full flavored. I love the honest approach.

The interior was cute- sparse, modern, but with small touches of warmth. I highly regret not taking home a pound of their coffee. Southern California is so lacking in micro roasters like these. I ask you to step outside the norm and reach for something better in your cup, Ritual will not disappoint.
author: Sheena M.

description:
Love the baristas here! They're always really sweet and talkative. So cool that Ritual has a pop-up shop right in the middle of Hayes Valley. 
Only complaint is that their cappuccinos just don't seem to have enough caffeine in 'em. I was tired only a few hours later!
author: Laura S.

description: Good location, nice atmosphere. I tried espresso. Unbelievably super sour. I thought I was sipping like balsamic vinegar. I wonder why so many people are giving five starts to their coffee. Is the acidic (new wave) coffee really that good? I may be should try few more times?
author: Ryuji G.

description: I like Ritual and the stand made out of a shipping container is pretty cool, wonder how they got it approved. It's a pretty dope location, I'm guessing it must have impacted the nearby Blue Bottle stand that operates out of a nearby garage. No complaints about their cappuccinos and the staff was pretty friendly for 8:45 am. In addition to all the coffee options you'd expect they have a small selection of baked goods. Credit cards are accepted via Square in case you're low on cash.
author: Jeremy S.

description: The best effing coffee. I've become quite the coffee snob, and ritual is my utmost favorite! Can you please open a location in Berkeley?
author: Kristina S.

description:
I'm sorry Four Barrel, but I have a secret... I've been cheating on you.

The coffee is excellent and strong! The pop-up shop is fantastic! The people are friendly, nice and not pretentious - no coffee snobiness here! Plus, they wear nifty overalls with gold buttons!  You can also buy beans here; bonus points - they won't look at you with disdain if you ask them to grind it!

I think I may be in love....
author: Gev M.

description: Fantastic coffee. Hayes Valley has become a hub for the best coffee in the city.
author: KK L.

description:
OMG! this place is so amazing.  The drip coffee was grounded and strained to order! The coffee is light and smooth, which I like because Blue Bottle is way too strong and bitter. 

My latte came with a heart on top, just  amazing.The baristas are super nice and chatty, I think they have to be cause it takes a while. 

The only downside is that is takes for ever for a drip so if you are running late don't even try to squeeze this cup of joe in! ohh yeah and its 5 bucks per cup :)

Ideal for an after lunch cup when you have time  for a stroll around the park!!!
author: Angela R.

description:
Pretty good

i think the coffee was too strong for me

couldnt sleep well last night!

i love hanging out at Hayes Valley
author: Carol Y.

description:
Ritual has fantastic espresso based drinks. Their lattes are some of the best I've had. The drip coffee comes on a wooden board with a simple, elegant cup and the extra amount in a small carafe. Their Blondie's, half cookie half brownie, are great accompaniment.

Being able to bring your cup and saucer across the street and sit in the park to enjoy brings this location one more step above the rest in a city that generally lacks such pleasures.
author: Michael S.

description:
Got a pourover of a Colombian bean, decaf. Was nice and mellow. Workers are charming and it's hard to beat the location on a sunny day. Cute shop is full of handcrafted subtleties too, like the wooden iPad stand and the trash bins.

Not too much else to report. It shares the same tent/shack as smitten. Is there such thing as a coffee float?
author: Christophe C.

description: A really neat walk up stand that has excellent coffee. If you have a dog it's a great place to stop on your morning walk, dog treats even available at the front. The line can get a little long but the service is very friendly and the coffee is even better.
author: Amanda C.

description: What a cute little shipping container to get a capuccino at (with Smittens and a playground nearby!)  Perfect for an afternoon walk or a chilly day watching your kids play at the playground.  Love it here!
author: Karyn L.

description:
Basic drip coffee. Nothing overly special to me, but I frequent highly rated cafes all the time so maybe I'm just jaded. 

Great spot for a nice day outdoors. Can get a little uncomfortably or amusingly hipster round here.
author: Angela K.

description:
I love my coffee and for some reason, I always flock to this Ritual location (versus the one in the Mission) for my cap and latte needs. They're always made consistently every time I'm here and just prefer this outdoor environment over the overly-hipster ridden Mission in SF. 

Plus, you have Miette's and Chantal Guillon close by for your macaron sweets to pair your coffee with all within a less than 5 minute walking distance. What more could you ask for?!

This place is tied on my list of go-to coffee bars along with Four Barrel on Valencia, the Blue Bottle just down the street on Linden St., Coffee Cultures on Bush, and Coffee Bar FiDi.
author: Tiffany H.

description: All outdoor seating. I tend to grab and go at this location. But this place is all about the coffee. A must for any coffee connoisseur. Quality coffee. I am willing to go out of my way to include Ritual in my day.
author: Sara P.

description: Ran into a pop up shop of this delectable coffee shop. Love the mocha drink, the drip process they use in making the coffee is also quite interesting.
author: Donna L.

description: I love this place. The coffee is made perfectly as the flavor profile of each variety is brought out by proper application of the process. However, I have to ding this place one star for lacking WiFi. If I pay $11 for a mocha and a cookie, I expect to be able to check my e-mail.
author: Damian E.

description:
Damn good coffee!  That's the most important thing.  
But the blackberry scone I had was damn good too!  
And sitting outside and enjoying them both together in SF ~that's the best!
author: D B.

description:
I popped in here accidentally after finding out smitten is not open for the day yet. seems like a cup of coffee is a good alternative. I must have been late to the party and didn't know exactly how to drink this coffee. First, it took forever to brew a simple cup of coffee, I don't like my coffee too complicated, but really? do I really need to watch someone pouring water into the grinded coffee bean ever so slowly? then I put some sugar in my coffee (big, big mistake), it didn't seem to taste like the coffee I normally had. I put more sugar in there, and it tastes the same. then I started to really enjoy the coffee with all it's fruitiness and flavors, which has been over-shadowed by the sugar and cream. but it's still there. 

a few weeks later, I was attending a meeting at a building I don't normally go to. I was getting coffee before the meeting and saw somebody making coffee just the same way Ritual was and he offered to make me a cup to lure me to give up the peet's that's been sitting there since this morning. sure, why not? then this guy started to tell me all about coffee and for the first time I tasted coffee without cream or sugar, and it just totally reminded me of ritual and made me really miss it. I'm so hooked to that originality of coffee now and yes, I've given up on Peet's. Ritual has de-virginized me when it comes to coffee drinking, in a way. hahah!
author: Cicie W.

description: Iced coffee was on the sour side for me... not sure why there was a long line for this?
author: Janet H.

description:
Me likes the new location! I actually stumbled upon here after parking next to a place we were planning to go and realizing that Blue Bottle was around the corner on Linden. Unfortunately neither the bf nor I had any cash so in our search for an atm, we found Ritual! 

Being kind of a Ritual addict, I insisted on this over Blue Bottle and was delighted to find technology at work with card charging on iPhones and iPads! I don't know about their drip coffee since I'm a strict espresso and latte girl, but their lattes beat Blue Bottles in my opinion. I even have a coffee card with 10 stamps to prove it since I've somehow gone over 10 times to SF, just for the coffee!

I like this location because its sort of a place where you can walk around. The other ritual locations are great for when you want to sit in and have an intimate conversation; I can't speak for the weather on Saturday but it was still nice to see kids, dogs, families playing in the park next to Ritual and enjoying a nice latte in the semi-sunshine.
author: Lorrie M.

description:
The chai: well-spiced and not overly sweet, with an intense gingery kick. Light enough that you can drink it after a lunch of pizza and three scoops of smitten. Not saying that's something I do... often. 

The cookies: the peanut butter cookie is soft and crumbly with crunchy (almonds? peanuts?) bits, and the coconut macaroon was exactly the way I like 'em -- soft, chewy, slightly caramelly flavor. Both delicious, though the macaroon was my favorite. 

The baristas: so sweet and friendly, with lots of patience even though they were just about to close up shop.
author: Angela N.

description:
The drip cofee is definately yummy and unique. 

The service is a little uncomfortable when the gentleman behind the counter, is griping their coworker in front of the customers.

Happy I tried their offering, but likely not to return.
author: Anthony C.

description: Im a fan of the Mission locale which I used to go to when my friend was around the corner from it. Little did I know that they had a ProxySF container here in Hayes Valley. Super friendly staff and solid caffeinated drinks. Since it was a sunny day I went the iced chai route instead and was wholly satisfied with my cold beverage choice.
author: Kim N.

description: Best cappuccino in SF. Comparable to Aussie and European coffee. Baristas are very knowledgeable and friendly. New favourite coffee spot in the heart of Hayes Valley
author: Amy M.

description:
Ritual is awesome.  The pop-up is a beautiful little red riding hood and hayes valley is the wolf.  The coffee is great, the design will blow your effing mind, the espresso will make your taste buds delight and dance as it rolls across your tongue.

Sundays are 1pm cuppings, which are free and you can join.  No one knows about them.  You are able to compare the three coffees that are in rotation in one session.  The valley provides beautiful weather, and ritual provides coffee that is unmatched.
author: Alex H.

description:
The best coffee in the city hands down.

Papa November comes a very close second, but Ritual has an edge by providing an all in all more smooth and tasty coffee in a much nicer location (Hayes valley is one of my favorites on a sunny day) with smitten's just on the other side to enjoy your coffee with :).
author: Assaf B.

description:
If you've been living in SF for awhile you're no stranger to all kinds of pop-up progressive businesses. iPad cash registers, unique recycled materials, refurbished buildings, and slick young hipsters working behind the counter with all manner of tattoos, piercings, and a vast array of knowledge on specialty products. 

Anyways Ritual Coffee has it all. Location right in the center of Hayes Valley downtown. Across from the park once can always find the tiny little open air coffee shop pleasantly surrounded by a diverse crowd of suburban SF families, personal trainers and their trainee's, hipsters, health food nuts, and even sheik fashionistas. The surrounding area of boutiques, bars, and restaurants, trends to attract all walks of life for the delicious coffee. Not that I drink coffee at all, but the few coffee nuts I know swear by this place. The infamous Blue Bottle of the Bay area put to shame by this small time up and comer. 

Anyways the staff is pretty awesome. Very friendly and knowledgable and are cool to talk to. You'll find they know alot about coffee and more about other topics as well. Last time I was there We chatted about our fav cocktails and where to find them in SF. 

A big plus about this place is it's location. They have outdoor seating, but since it's right next to the park you can easily bask in the sun right next door or even walk and explore the boutiques and other places all around hayes valley. If you like ice cream its directly next to Smitten, basically the ice cream equivalent of Ritual.
author: Harrison M.

description: Cute little stand outside, so on sunny days it's perfect. Only issue I have is that my iced chai was extremely watered down. Maybe next time I'll get some coffee.
author: Dominique F.

description:
Discovered this brand new branch of Ritual today when going next door to Smitten ice cream in Hayes valley. It's kind of a "static" coffee cart, serving great coffee out of a shipping container. Apparently this and Smitten are the first two units of what will eventually be a mini gourmet ghetto of similar businesses. Yet more reasons to visit Hayes Valley beyond the Fatted Calf as far as I can see.

I had a delicious creamy machiato served in real china by the owner - it was just what I needed as a pick me up before my ice cream. It's really a takeaway kind of set up but there are a few funky chairs nearby if you want to linger.
author: Diarmuid R.

description: Cool little park with Ritual coffee inside a used and converted trailer box. There is good outdoor seating and a park for kiddies right next door. And Smitten ice cream! The coffee was served on a wooden plate and with carafe. Very nice touch. if you are looking for a relaxing outdoor coffee spot to have some good conversations this is the place.
author: James W.

description:
This was my first visit to a Ritual, as I was visiting from LA and many of my friends had recommended me to try the coffee.

Ritual operates out of one of those hipster converted shipping containers and has some small tables in front for seating. I ordered their macchiato to go (since they were closing in 10 minutes). While I was waiting for my drink to be prepared, I got some help from the friendly cashier in purchasing my first pound of Ritual whole beans. She was so helpful in giving recommendations and descriptions of the flavors/roasts of their beans, and the optimal method to brew each in order to bring out their full potential. Talk about top notch customer service!

My macchiato was amazing! The complex notes of the espresso really came through. Really wish they had locations down in southern California!

Great area to hang out with a cup of coffee on a sunny day...if you're okay with being in a super dense hipster area!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I've heard many things about Ritual Coffee so I made sure to stop by this stand.

It was a hot day so I wanted chilled tea, but they can't ice the tea out of fear of diluting the true flavor of the tea. For this, I wish they had some tea saved on the side in a little fridge or something. I like chilled tea and the selection of the teas they have seem really awesome.

The only things they can ice are the coffee drinks that aren't exactly thirst quenching...but I bought one anyway. I got an iced mocha. 

The coffee is great quality and the chocolate flavor wasn't overly sugared syrupy crap. I approve of this mocha. 

This stand is kind of out of the way, but I wouldn't mind grabbing something from there again. Hopefully it will be chilly so I can enjoy something from their tea menu.
author: Sofia R.

description: Coffee at this place is pretty fantastic. I haven't bought any from Starbucks for at least a few month because it can't replicate the same level of satisfaction. Hama, Ethiopia is my favorite. It is a bit on a pricey side for coffee, but it is worth the money and fewer calories than a latte.
author: D P.

description: Ritual is a third wave coffee roaster originating in San Francisco. Its main competitors are Blue Bottle Coffee and Four Barrel, which have the similar light flavor, and sometimes sour taste. In any case this is a top notch third wave coffee roaster in SF.
author: Jay C.

description:
When Ritual first opened up in Hayes Valley, I lived two blocks away. Used to drinking $1-$2 coffee, I was alarmed at the prices of Ritual's pour-overs. $5 for a cup of coffee?! Absurd, I thought!

But I have come to realize that Ritual is worth every cent. I have tasted pour-overs from Blue Bottle (San Francisco), Four Barrel (San Francisco), Intelligentsia (Chicago), Bow Truss (Chicago), Gaslight (Chicago), and more, and the conclusion is always that Ritual is the best. The pour-overs are always light, subtle, and perfect. Ditch your sugar and cream, because you won't need or want it. Yes, they take awhile to make and yes, it's more expensive than Starbucks or Peet's, but the quality is the best. And if you're really in a rush, you can always go for one of the espresso drinks. I prefer pour-over, but the espresso-based drinks are good too.

They always have three pour-over options at three price points - $3, $4, and $5. The current coffee brews as of September 2013 are the Sibera ($3), El Angel ($4), and Los Ananos ($5). My favorite is by far El Angel, and due to the price, I prefer Sibera over Los Ananos. Whatever you get, I promise you'll walk away satisfied!
author: Talia G.

description:
I love this Ritual location. There's something about grabbing a smooth capp or iced americano here, sitting in one of their store-front chairs or a park bench and just enjoy being in your friends/coworkers/strangers' company. The baristas are lovely and actually care about making you the best cup of coffee you deserve, not about how much of a coffee snob you can be. Love the Alamo Square neighborhood too, wish I could come by every day.

Tip: I prefer the chairs right in front of the shop as sometimes you see/smell dog poop that you can't unsee/unsmell if you're closer to the grass/trees area and that can be really unpleasant. Don't let irresponsible dog walkers ruin your morning coffee.
author: Jackie C.

description: Have only purchased the espresso beans and was disappointed in the taste.  Felt like they had been over roasted and did not match the description by the barrista or the website. Seems to be a popular place based on the line of people and the other reviews, so I might have to try a latte or an espresso in the near future.
author: Frank C.

description:
Great coffee! 

Their flavor is very distinctive, which I find refreshing! It has some spicy notes!
author: Alberte K.

description: Great coffee but the staff are what really make this place awesome. Super friendly, cool people with great attitudes!
author: Kaitlin K.

description: This one's easy.  Great coffee, awesome location, friendly service, and it's unique.  We come here every time we visit SF and will definitely be back in October.  SF is full of delicious roasters and this is near the top of my list along with the usual suspects.
author: David B.

description:
DRINK:
1.) Coffee - more on the acidic side

SERVICE:
workers are nice

ATMOSPHERE:
Cute outdoor in Hayes proctor projects. On the side of the cute small grassy park to sit around, ppl watch, meander to the Hayes Valley shops, stores, restaurants, etc.
author: Angela L.

description:
I'm a total fan of their drip coffees (~$3? I believe) and lattes ( $4.50 w/ soy) . STRONG and rich flavors- I'm always sad(yet jittery!) when I'm nearing the end of my cup. 
Staff was knowledgable and friendly. 

A MUST-TRY for all coffee fans.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Great little location especially when you're hanging out in Hayes Valley in the little park on Octavia!  

I ordered the featured brew, El Silencio and boy did it keep me up all night!!!! Great cup of coffee! 

What I liked about this place was the service!  The gals working here were great and helpful. What I didn't like (and the reason this place lost a star) ....the price of the coffee.  It was a little overpriced...$5 for a cup? Good thing it was strong enough to wake me up.
author: Caroline A.

description:
The coffee is good, much better then Starbucks or the espresso you'd find at the Grove or Arlequin, but it's not stand out delicoius.

What is awesome about this place, and why I give it four stars, is the location.  It's probably the most beautiful spot to grab a coffee in the city.  The coffee bar is located in what looks like an empty parking lot right next to a park.  They have these awesome lounge chairs and on a beautiful sunny day there is no better place to be.

Also, they give you the coffee in a pot, and you get to pour it into a tiny mug.  Both items come on this little wooden plate.  It's just an awesome experience.  A place to relax, forget about all your worries, and just enjoy the simplicity of a beautiful day and wonderful cup of joe.
author: Evelyn N.

description:
More than ever, I feel like I'm living in San Francisco here. More than flabongo-ing on Natoma with elderly vomit between my feet. More than being at a SF Giants game (really). More than seeing the Golden Gate Bridge (really). How's that possible? I'm on the ground, I'm exchanging money (it's F'ing expensive here, kids) and I'm caffeinated (that's how it's elevated beyond Bay-side baseball & Golden Gate-ing). 

It's in a shipping container, in a posh beyond get out nabe, it's street side, everyone's striking & goodlooking that works here, they love their job, they love coffee, the coffee is perfect craft coffee, and there's potential that everyone is either: European tourists, locals in lululemon and there's a lululemon commercial being shot on location here. Plus, often times I arrive in a Zip Car, I check in on a Yelp App, I wait 5 minutes for $5 worth every bit of $5 coffee and I see someone order an Oreo that's a house made Oreo. San Francisco.
author: Jon A.

description: Excellent coffee.  The pour over was smooth and tasty.
author: love n.

description:
San Fran. The heart of coffee places that are famous and have no actual building. iPad cash registers? Check. It's in the booth right behind Smitten Ice Cream, and it's near a park, so it's a cool spot to grab some coffee and walk around Hayes Valley or pet dogs in the park. 

Blue Bottle probably beats it out, but it's really good coffee. Smooth and brewed on the spot. Cool staff, modern venue, and a bag of beans is like $15-20 (a little pricey), but I think it was worth it. Honestly, it's a good spot for anyone who is commuting, walking, or biking in the area.
author: Sam A.

description:
Love the pop up shop idea! And it fits in perfectly with the neighborhood. Grab a cup o' joe and go browse some stores or sip coffee from real cups on the few seats they have outside (I was surprised that a good amount of people were siting down with their coffee in non to go cups)

Despite the great idea- maybe I got a bad batch? but my mocha tasted kind of weak and super milky, and for a mocha, not very chocolatey at all. Clearly, i should order something else next time. 

And it seemed like they might be cash only, but they actually swipe credit cards on the ipod by the register
author: Sarah S.

description: Hipster Central, and staff is nice but definitely can be frank with customers. Coffee was good but wish for a little more flavor to come through their cold brew (a fan of Ethiopian brews)
author: Xavier L.

description:
On my innocent stroll to visit my old haunt of espresso goodness, aka Blue Bottle's original kiosk in Hayes Valley, what to my surprise do I happen upon a container truck with a third wave espresso temple built into the side!  Complete with bubbling girls ordering and bouncing, and a very serious barista taking your order.  With this much red, and ritual coffee symbols everywhere, I pretty much known I'm doomed.  There's no chance I'm ever gonna make it over to Blue Bottle now. 

It's just not fair how much damn fine coffee they got in this Brooklyn adjunct...
author: Sean S.

description: Ok so there's blue bottle (yuck it's too consumer, and Phils mehhhhh) And then there's Ritual.... dude this place is so unique. There's no where else like this spot in SF.
